New Records: Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's unbeaten partnership of 190 runs is the highest for any side at 5th wicket or below in T20Is.
Rohit Sharma's 121* is the highest score by an Indian captain in T20Is.
India scored the highest total for a team after losing 4 wickets for 25 runs or less, reaching 212/4.
Rohit Sharma now holds the record for scoring the most runs as an Indian captain in T20Is, surpassing Virat Kohli's tally.
Rohit Sharma is the second captain after Babar Azam to hit three T20I centuries as the captain of the team.
The third T20I helped Rohit equal MS Dhoni's record of winning 42 T20Is for India.
With this series win, India now have 9 whitewash series wins in T20I cricket, the most by any country.
Key Match Events: The match required two Super Overs to conclude, setting a historic precedent.
India won the match on the second Super Over, a first in international cricket history.
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh scored 36 runs in the final over, matching the highest run tally in a single over in T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series win gives India the most whitewash series wins in T20I cricket.
The match marked Rohit Sharma's dominance as a captain and batsman in T20I cricket.
